workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 1
notes: First day on the push presses today, we are going to focus on getting a nice rack position, with elbows up (watch the video for help!) and i want you to pause 1s in the dip position and 1s overhead please, keep a vertical torso on your dip and make sure it is pain free on your knees!
7 sets of 5 reps - for weight, just find something EASY today to start, ok to go up each set to figure out what weight to use but the only focus is pausing that dip and pausing overhead
make sure you stack that skeleton overhead when you pause please

workouts.title: Strict Press - SS - Week 1
notes: After all those push presses i'm sure your shoulders will be pumped, but we are going to just put a tiny bit more volume into the press

3 sets of 8 reps - i want you to use the same weight for all 3 sets but again i want you to pause overhead for 1s each rep and learn to stack your skeleton when you are overhead - to pick weight today it is best to be reserved and start a little to light ... 6/10 effort is the aim but you will be pumped

workouts.title: Dips w/ Serratus Raise - SS - Week 1
notes: Make sure you watch the video, owning the serratus raise is important!

it says 3 x 10, but think more 3 sets of 10 maximum, if you get over 10, add weight .. ideally we want to work about 5-8 rep range, using a slow tempo and owning that raise at the top makes these hard even if you're light, rest about 2 mins
if you're a big heavy stronglump then you might need to use band assistance to start

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 1
notes: I like a neutral grip here but you can do whatever suits, also if you are in a gym with a nice back machine it's ok to swap for that if you prefer!
i want 5 sets of 10 reps, first set easy warm up set, then add weight to each set and end heavy but with room to progress weekly - around 2 mins rest

cues i want you to think about is at the bottom of the movement REACH as far as you can and stretch those scaps, then when you row, come to lower chest and try to hold a 1s squeze, by the last set you will struggle to hold that!

workouts.title: IYT Raises - SS - Week 1-5
notes: 1 rep = a I Y T - we are going to hit these for 5 weeks straight, so today start really light, they are harder than they sound, and make sure you get full ROM each rep
3 sets of 8 reps (so 24 raises total!) i want fairly low rest and you will be really pumped after this
as the weeks go on, you won't be able to progress load to much, so just get better at them, more ROM and if you do feel you can go heavier you can when necessary

workouts.title: Front Squat - SS - Week 1
notes: If you struggle with rack position mobility it is okay to use straps here if you need to.
Here i want you to focus on opening up the hips, and increasing range in that bottom position. I then want you to accelerate out of the hole as fast as possible.

workouts.title: Deadlift - SS - Week 1
notes: 1 rep = 1 deadlift with 3-5s eccentric back to the floor, hold the position on the floor for 3 full seconds without losing tension then perform a speed rep

The reason we are doing this is to really solidify a solid starting position on the deadlift. When you control the eccentric, focusing on maintaining good tightness you will finish in your mechanically most efficient deadlift position. From here I want you to hold this position to build your awareness of where the position should be.
The reason for the speed pull after is to then learn to produce maximal force production from this position to really rewire where your best DL starting position is.

workouts.title: Pendlay Row - SS - Week 1
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - strict as fuck form

I want the starting position of this row to replicate our new found deadlift position perfectly. Make sure that you are holding the same positions you were during the deadlifts, and then row up to your belly button.

workouts.title: Pronated Pull Up - SS - Week 1
notes: 2s hang at the bottom of each rep here please !
Hold back here this week, will be progressing accumulated reps weekly.
IF you are accumulating more than 30 reps (overall from the 3 sets, so averaging 10+ reps per set) - start adding load here also. Feel free to also use a band if needed to assist the pull ups

workouts.title: Machine Row - SS - Week 1
notes: 2 sets of 20 reps - get a real good stretch each rep here, squeeze and hold for a second at the top of each rep

workouts.title: Single Arm Cable Row - SS - Week 1
notes: Make sure to be getting a big stretch at the start of each rep, rotate and squeeze into your pocket for 2 seconds each rep

workouts.title: Machine Preacher Curl - SS - Week 1
notes: if you dont have a machine this is fine, you can do a standard preacher curl instead, or rest your elbow against a bench and do unilateral db preachers instead

workouts.title: Cable Bicep Curl - SS - Week 1
workouts.reps: Cable Bicep Curl -
notes: warm up doing 2-3 sets of around 10 reps at lighter load
- load to be around the 6-9 rep range before concentric failure - you will maybe only need 1 warm up set after the first exercise
(go to concentric failure, then do cheat reps for 2-5 / while controlling the eccentrics/isometrics)

workouts.title: Back Squat - SS - Week 1
notes: 1.5 reps - the goal here is to build comfort in the bottom of the hole, so:
1 rep = go down, squat half way up, control it back down and then perform a full squat back up
This should be fairly comfortable this week, make sure that your hip crease is minimum sinking below your knee every rep. Keep nice and tight throughout.

workouts.title: Snatch Grip High Pull - SS - Week 1
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - light load here about 40% of your best clean ever clean-

What I want you to do on these is to control down to just below the knee every rep and focus on hitting your hips and triple extending, and really feeling that explosion coming from the triple extension.
Make sure you keep the bar path close here, and dont let the bar escape forward.

workouts.title: Power Clean/Push Press - SS - Week 1
notes: 70% of your best ever bar FTOH

Using the same skills we drilled in with the high hang pulls, I want you to really focus on controlling that barbell off of the floor, and waiting until you connect with the hips. At the hips generate as much force as possible through the triple extension into your rack position. From here we are going to try and cement what we have been learning on Day 1 with the pauses on the push presses

workouts.title: BTN Seated Strict Press - SS - Week 1
notes: Behind The Neck Seated Strict Press
3 sets of 10 reps - 2s pause at the bottom and top of each rep
rpe 5 load - will be progressing weekly here so make sure that you are being conservative on W1

We are all going to have different mobilities here, but I want you to aim for as much ROM as possible. If this is something you struggle with aim to get down as close to the bottom of your traps as possible. Hold this position at the bottom (dont just rest it on your traps) - then power back up and hold overhead.

workouts.title: Short Step Lunge - SS - Week 1
notes: RPE 6 Load - should start building this up fairly heavy by end of block
Ideally use an SSB bar, but if you do not have one a regular barbell will work fine also.

I want your strides here to mimic the stride length of a yoke/farmers. Small step and lunge into it. Rather than think of this as an exercise to pump up your legs, think of it as assiting your moving events (and squat).

workouts.title: Deadlift Stance Leg Press - SS - Week 1
notes: rpe 7 load - you should be able to load this up fairly heavy given that you are basically doing half reps here

Make sure that you're watching the video here guys, I want 1/2 reps here same amount of flexion you get when youre doing a deadlift. Think of this as an accessory for your deadlift rather than a "leg day"

workouts.title: Yoke - SS - Week 1
notes: 4x20m in sub 8s - you can ascend weight here but this should be very manageable, just want you to get to grips with the implement, and keeping a tight time cap so you can't go too heavy too quickly. Let's work on starting in a split stance, keeping a rigid upper back and keeping the chest high

workouts.title: Front Carry - SS - Week 1
workouts.reps: Using a sandbag of choice (something light here for you, that you could probably carry for 50+m unbroken):
notes: Jog 20m then sprint 20m back then carry the sandbag 20m (= 1 rep)

workouts.title: Sandbag to Shoulder - SS - Week 1
notes: 10min EMOM - 2 reps every minute w/ light sandbag - Watch video for technique, get to grips with the movement here, and play around with your triple extension and pick-ups to optimise ease of movement

workouts.title: Stones to Platform - SS - Week 1
notes: Lap and load stone to platform here - using the same stone on all reps, keep this super light, just working on technique here, bringing the feet back in once in the lapped position and good triple extensions

workouts.title: Rower - SS - Week 1
notes: 4 rounds - aiming to keep a faster 500m pace each round than your best 2k time .

workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 2
notes: Week 2 - this is the same reps and sets as last week, and we are going to pause in the dip position and overhead again, just the same as last week, unfortunately skill takes time and reps to build haha

7 sets of 5 reps - for weight, you have a reference last week now, so i want you to try to progress by making the weight the same for all sets, so last week you should of gone up each set, this week maybe use the last or 2nd to last weight for all sets
make sure you stack that skeleton overhead when you pause please and own that leg drive

workouts.title: Strict Press - SS - Week 2
notes: this week i want you to just try to progress the 3 x 8 reps by a tiny bit, even 2.5kg is fine
remember, progression can come through many ways, today the goal really is to handle the volume better, so we don't need to go wild on extra loading
i still want a 1s pause overhead each rep

workouts.title: Dips w/ Serratus Raise - SS - Week 2
notes: Make sure you watch the video, owning the serratus raise is important! - this is the same as last week on purpose, the goal is to get more reps total or to add more weight and keep linear progressions going

it says 3 x 10, but think more 3 sets of 10 maximum, if you get over 10, add weight .. ideally we want to work about 5-8 rep range, using a slow tempo and owning that raise at the top makes these hard even if you're light, rest about 2 mins
if you're a big heavy stronglump then you might need to use band assistance to start

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 2
notes: same set up as last week, 1 set less
but i want you to use the same weight for all sets as your heaviest set last week, rest about 2 mins please

workouts.title: IYT Raises - SS - Week 1-5
notes: 1 rep = a I Y T - we are going to hit these for 5 weeks straight, so today start really light, they are harder than they sound, and make sure you get full ROM each rep
3 sets of 8 reps (so 24 raises total!) i want fairly low rest and you will be really pumped after this
as the weeks go on, you won't be able to progress load to much, so just get better at them, more ROM and if you do feel you can go heavier you can when necessary

workouts.title: Front Squat - SS - Week 2
notes: 8 sets of 3 reps - @42.5% - Even though the load is progressing weekly I want you to focus on trying to increase velocity out of the hole weekly
If you struggle with rack position mobility it is okay to use straps here if you need to.
Here i want you to focus on opening up the hips, and increasing range in that bottom position. I then want you to accelerate out of the hole as fast as possible.

workouts.title: Farmers Walks - SS - Week 2
notes: This week we'll be working on farmers and we'll continue to alternate between yoke and farmers every week:
2x10m drop turn 10m - sub 11s - let's work on light farmers today and focus on nice speedy drop turns and quick pick-ups in a split stance start

workouts.title: Front Carry - SS - Week 2
workouts.reps: Carry Medley this week:
notes: If you don't have access to all of these implements you can use multiple sandbags, to avoid having to carry implements back, just move the yoke down the other end after each set, 3 sets of:

workouts.title: Sandbag To Shoulder- SS - Week 2
notes: 10min EMOM - 2 reps every minute w/ slightly heavier sandbag

workouts.title: Stones To Platform - SS - Week 2
notes: 5 sets of 3 - One motion stone this week, might be worth going lighter or at the very least same stone weight as last week, want you to really focus on your triple extension here

workouts.title: Rower - SS - Week 2
notes: work @ RPE 9 on every single sprint, i expect the times for each 250m to drop as the rounds go on.

workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 3
notes: Right team into week 3 now, we are going to remove that pause in the dip position guys, and just focus on getting more speed and faster with the reps, i still want a 1s hold overhead though just to build that position

to help with speed we are going to to do "reactive reps" this week, what this means is as you bring the bar down into rack position, i want you to dip and catch at the same time and absorb the force and redirect it back up, ive added a different video to show this so you can watch that, although the video is from behind the neck, just do it front rack!
7 x 5 reps again and i want you to use a similar load to last week, your progression is going to be the reactive reps and getting more fluid
if things are moving well and smooth its ok to go heavier - about 2 mins rest

workouts.title: Strict Press - SS - Week 3
notes: 3x8 - ascending sets today, i want you to end heavy this week, so lets this 1 easy set, a final warm up. Then take a moderate effort set, then take a final heavy set
this week however, i want you to focus on keeping your head back, and only bring your head through on the final rep of each set and hold for 2-3 seconds .

workouts.title: Dips w/ Serratus Raise - SS - Week 3
notes: Make sure you watch the video, owning the serratus raise is important! - this is the same as last week on purpose, the goal is to get more reps total or to add more weight and keep linear progressions going

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 3
notes: Today, warm up and take a estimated 20RM, i don't mind if there is a bit of cheating, towards the end
whatever you hit for the set of 20, do 1 more set of 12, then 1 set of 10

workouts.title: Pendlay Row - SS - Week 3
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - strict as fuck form
Small progressions weekly, this is going to be a basic linear progression throughout the plan

Hopefully now we are on week three the starting position for these rows feel a little less foreign as the weeks go on, keep the progressions steady here, main focus is to really cement and strengthen that statring position from the floor.

workouts.reps: Rower (or ski-erg)
notes: 1k  row for time, I want you to work at full send pace
do a few mins warm up then rest so you're ready to go, make sure you beat the pace you set on your 2k time a few sessions back.

workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 4
workouts.reps: 5 sets of 5 today so we have a tiny volume drop of 2 sets
notes: we are going to hit those reactive reps again but this time i am removing the pause at the top of the lift so you can get into a real nice flow state

weight wise, judge off last weeks work .. maybe similar weight maybe a touch heavier, with push press alot of progression needs to come through technique and speed, so make sure your dip is good, lockout good and flow is good, if it is then you can go heavier! strict press after is where we can push weight more if needed

workouts.title: High Hang Pull - SS - Week 4
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - light load here about 47.5% of your best clean ever clean-

What I want you to do on these is to control down to just below the knee every rep and focus on hitting your hips and triple extending, and really feeling that explosion coming from the triple extension.
Make sure you keep the bar path close here, and dont let the bar escape forward.

workouts.title: Power Clean/Push Press - SS - Week 4
notes: 70% of your best ever bar FTOH
We're on week 4 now, you should be seeing technical improvments on your cleans now. It should feel like you're catching that perfect triple extension at the hips each time.
Make sure youre pulling slow from the floor, really controlling the bar into that hip crease, and exploding from there.

workouts.title: BTN Seated Strict Press - SS - Week 4
notes: Behind The Neck Seated Strict Press
3 sets of 10 reps - 2s pause at the bottom and top of each rep
Very small progressions weekly - 2.5-5% per week here please

We are all going to have different mobilities here, but I want you to aim for as much ROM as possible here. If this is something you struggle with aim to get down as close to the bottom of your traps as possible. Hold this position at the bottom (dont just rest it on your traps) - then power back up and hold overhead.

workouts.title: Short Step Lunge - SS - Week 4
notes: Ideally use an SSB bar, but if you do not have one a regular barbell will work fine also.

I want your strides here to mimic the stride length of a yoke/farmers. Small step and lunge into it. Rather than think of this as an exercise to pump up your legs, think of it as assiting your moving events (and squat).

workouts.title: Deadlift Stance Leg Press - SS - Week 4
notes: Progress load weekly, on this you should be able to load the leg press real heavy

Make sure that you're watching the video here guys, I want 1/2 reps here same amount of flexion you get when youre doing a deadlift. Think of this as an accessory for your deadlift rather than a "leg day"

workouts.title: Farmers Walks - SS - Week 4
notes: This week we'll be working on straight runs with no drops:

4x20m - sub 10s - Allow the weight to be dictated by the time cap this week, as we have no drops you should be able to load this up a little heavier than last time, work on good gait mechanics and fast steps

workouts.title: Front Carry - SS - Week 4
notes: Let's use the same implements as a couple weeks ago, but let's aim to move faster and recover better than last time (time this), 3 sets of:

workouts.title: Sandbag To Shoulder - SS - Week 4
notes: 10min EMOM -  1 rep on even minutes 2 reps on odd minutes w/ heavier sandbag

workouts.title: Stones To Platform - SS - Week 4
workouts.reps: 3 sets of 3 - One motion stone this week, let's work up this week and go for some heavier stones for 3, but for fewer sets

workouts.title: Rower - SS - Week 4
workouts.reps: Rower (or ski-erg)

workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 5
workouts.reps: 5RM today, ascending load
notes: right team you have done ALOT of work on technique, so today we can go a little heavier, i want you to build up to the heaviest set of 5 you can hit, ideally no fails, so pick a sensible suitable weight!
whatever you hit drop 20% and do 3 more sets of 5 reps please

workouts.title: Strict Press - SS - Week 5
notes: Lets go about 5% up from last week please
same cues just 1 set less so 4x5 reps - rest as you need to get all the reps, keep head back throughout - bring through the last rep only

workouts.title: Dips w/ Serratus Raise - SS - Week 5
notes: Final week with the serratus raise, going to get heavier after this week

it says 3 x 10, but think more 3 sets of 10 maximum, if you get over 10, add weight .. ideally we want to work about 5-8 rep range, using a slow tempo and owning that raise at the top makes these hard even if you're light, rest about 2 mins
if you're a big heavy stronglump then you might need to use band assistance to start

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 5
notes: back to higher reps, so hit a 15RM first, heaviest you can please
then use that weight for 1 set of 10 reps, then 1 more set of 8 reps

workouts.title: IYT Raises - SS - Week 1-5
notes: 1 rep = a I Y T - we are going to hit these for 5 weeks straight, so today start really light, they are harder than they sound, and make sure you get full ROM each rep
3 sets of 8 reps (so 24 raises total!) i want fairly low rest and you will be really pumped after this
as the weeks go on, you won't be able to progress load to much, so just get better at them, more ROM and if you do feel you can go heavier you can when necessary

workouts.title: Front Squat - SS - Week 5
notes: 8 sets of 2 reps - @50% - Even though the load is progressing weekly I want you to focus on trying to increase velocity out of the hole weekly
If you struggle with rack position mobility it is okay to use straps here if you need to.
Here I want you to focus on opening up the hips, and increasing range in that bottom position. I then want you to accelerate out of the hole as fast as possible.

workouts.title: Deadlift - SS - Week 5
notes: 12 sets of 2 reps - Normal reps this week, pull as fast as possible. Set a camera up on the side

Use this as a tester to see where your deadlift starting position is at at currently moment. Watch your videos after deadlifting and watch your hip positions. DO they shoot up? Are we seeing technical progress?

workouts.title: Pendlay Row - SS - Week 5
notes: 1 sets of 10 reps - strict as fuck form
Small progressions weekly, this is going to be a basic linear progression throughout the plan
It would be a good idea from here, to be filming these sets from the side, and look at your starting position. Does it look like hips are in the right place -

workouts.title: Pronated Pull Up - SS - Week 5
notes: 2s hang at the bottom of each rep here please !
90s rest - make sure youre sticking to this

workouts.title: Machine Row - SS - Week 5
notes: 2 sets of 12 reps - get a real good stretch each rep here, squeeze and hold for a second at the top of each rep

workouts.title: Single Arm Cable Row - SS - Week 5
notes: Make sure to be getting a big stretch at the start of each rep, rotate and squeeze into your pocket for 2 seconds each rep

workouts.title: Incline DB Supinated Bicep Curl - SS - Week 5

When it comes to the push press, make sure we are taking everything we are learning from day 1 and carrying it over. This is a chance to really cement our technique on both push press and clean.

workouts.title: Sandbag To Shoulder - SS - Week 5
notes: Every 90s work for 8 rounds (1 rep every 90s) - let's go for a heavier bag, something you haven't used ideally, and push this a bit here

pause overhead 1s on each rep, and make each set fast, rest about 2 minutes please between sets

3 sets of 6 reps, when the reps get low like this team OWN that eccentric, really slow back down

notes: No serratus raise again but i want you to do 2 sets of AMRAP at bodyweight with about 2 mins rest for your deload session

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 9
notes: Back to 20RM today team but use more weight than last time please
then use that weight for 1 x 12 then 1 x 10 please - around 2 mins rest

workouts.title: Powell Raises - SS - Weeks 6-10
notes: IYT's changing to just Powell Raises now, i want you to hit 3 sets of 6-8 reps L and 6-8 R for the next 5 weeks, we will linear slowly so start with easy sets of 8 and as the weeks go on by week 10 it should be hard set sof 6

workouts.title: Front Squat - SS - Week 9
notes: 8 sets of 1 reps - @60% - Even though the load is progressing weekly I want you to focus on trying to increase velocity out of the hole weekly
If you struggle with rack position mobility it is okay to use straps here if you need to.
Here I want you to focus on opening up the hips, and increasing range in that bottom position. I then want you to accelerate out of the hole as fast as possible.

workouts.title: Deadlift - SS - Week 9
notes: 1 rep = 1 deadlift with 3-5s eccentric back to the floor, hold the position on the floor for 3 full seconds without losing tension then perform a speed rep
6 sets of 1 rep @85% - Final week of these now lets fucking go!
rest as you need here now please

workouts.title: Pendlay Row - SS - Week 9
notes: 3 sets of 8 reps - Can start to use a little more momentum/body language here now if you need
rest increased this to about 2-3 minutes

workouts.title: Pronated Pull Up - SS - Week 9
notes: 2s hang at the bottom of each rep here please !
Taking these up a notch now !
Make sure that you are still hanging for 2 seconds between each rep. If you need to strap up fucking go for it, if you need to do these assisted in anyway etc again this is fine.

workouts.title: Machine Row - SS - Week 9
notes: 2 sets of 8 reps - get a real good stretch each rep here, squeeze and hold for a second at the top of each rep

workouts.title: Single Arm Cable Row - SS - Week 9
notes: Make sure to be getting a big stretch at the start of each rep, rotate and squeeze into your pocket for 2 seconds each rep

workouts.title: Incline DB Supinated Bicep Curl - SS - Week 9
notes: Probably looking around same load as last week here, but can drop it slightly if need - we will be progressing again next week

workouts.title: EZ Bar Bicep Curl - SS - Week 9
notes: E-Z Bar Bicep Curl - increase load weekly
Same protocol as were doing pre deload, but with an EZ Bar now
warm up doing 2-3 sets of around 10 reps at lighter load
- load to be around the 6-9 rep range before concentric failure - you will maybe only need 1 warm up set after the first exercise
(go to concentric failure, then do cheat reps for 2-5 / while controlling the eccentrics/isometrics)

workouts.title: Back Squat - SS - Week 9
notes: 1.5 reps - the goal here is to build comfort in the bottom of the hole, so:
1 rep = go down, squat half way up, control it back down and then perform a full squat back up
This should be fairly comfortable this week, make sure that your hip crease is minimum sinking below your knee every rep. Keep nice and tight throughout.

workouts.title: High Hang Pull - SS - Week 9
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - light load here about 60% of your best clean ever clean-
Really control that bar into the hip crease, make sure youre exploding from that triple extension position, make sure you keep that bar really close after extension.

workouts.title: Power Clean/Push Press - SS - Week 9
notes: Only make the load progression IF your clean and push press look and feel perfect. Make sure you're hitting your extensions perfectly, if you hit 10 perfect reps you should finish on 92.5%

workouts.title: BTN Seated Strict Press - SS - Week 9
notes: Behind The Neck Seated Strict Press
3 sets of 8 reps - 2s pause at the bottom and top of each rep
Progress load weekly - 2.5 - 5% progressions weekly only

We are all going to have different mobilities here, but I want you to aim for as much ROM as possible here. If this is something you struggle with aim to get down as close to the bottom of your traps as possible. Hold this position at the bottom (dont just rest it on your traps) - then power back up and hold overhead.

workouts.title: Short Step Lunge - SS - Week 9
notes: Ideally use an SSB bar, but if you do not have one a regular barbell will work fine also.

I want your strides here to mimic the stride length of a yoke/farmers. Small step and lunge into it. Rather than think of this as an exercise to pump up your legs, think of it as assiting your moving events (and squat).

workouts.title: Deadlift Stance Leg Press - SS - Week 9
notes: Make sure that you're watching the video here guys, I want 1/2 reps here same amount of flexion you get when youre doing a deadlift. Think of this as an accessory for your deadlift rather than a "leg day"

workouts.title: Yoke - SS - Week 9
notes: Work up to a top set of 20m - Keep the time under 12-15 seconds here and take a new PB set of 20m. Final week of yoke on this program so finish on a high.

workouts.title: Front Carry - SS - Week 9
notes: Take the same sandbag as last time for an extra rep or two today depending on how tough you find these.
Jog 20m then sprint 20m back then carry the sandbag 20m (= 1 rep)

workouts.title: Sandbag to Shoulder - SS - Week 9
notes: Max reps in 60 seconds - Take the same bag you hit 2 weeks ago and see if you can beat the number of reps you achieved during the time limit.

workouts.title: Stones To Platform - SS - Week 9
workouts.reps: 2 sets of 2 - Lap and load. Same high platform that you lifted to previously, just something that really challenges your extension. Try to progress load from the last time you lifted to this height with the rep drop.

workouts.title: Rower - SS - Week 9
notes: work @ RPE 9 on every single sprint, i expect the times for each 250m to drop as the rounds go on.

workouts.title: Push Press - SS - Week 10
workouts.reps: Final week so i want you to take heavy single please, this has been a really long training block and you should have reaped loads of rewards, so fucking send it today and take a big top single
notes: whatever you hit drop 25% and do 1 set of as many reactive reps as possible please !

workouts.title: Strict Press - SS - Week 10
workouts.reps: Today squad
notes: final send, take a big single please, beat that load from 2 weeks back

workouts.title: Dips - SS - Week 10
workouts.reps: 3 sets of 3 reps
notes: adding load to each set, i want you to finish with a big set of 3 dips, most weight you can
afterwards, take 1 full set of as many reps as you possibly can!

workouts.title: Wide Grip Cable Rows - SS - Week 10
notes: then use that weight for 3 x 5 reps - end of a big training cycle here, you should have a big back by now lol

workouts.title: Powell Raises - SS - Weeks 6-10
notes: IYT's changing to just Powell Raises now, i want you to hit 3 sets of 6-8 reps L and 6-8 R for the next 5 weeks, we will linear slowly so start with easy sets of 8 and as the weeks go on by week 10 it should be hard set sof 6

workouts.title: Front Squat - SS - Week 10
notes: 6 sets of 1 reps - @62.5% - Even though the load is progressing weekly I want you to focus on trying to increase velocity out of the hole weekly
If you struggle with rack position mobility it is okay to use straps here if you need to.
Here I want you to focus on opening up the hips, and increasing range in that bottom position. I then want you to accelerate out of the hole as fast as possible.

workouts.title: Deadlift - SS - Week 10
notes: Past 9 weeks have been fairly intense and will have been fairly taking, so going to bring intensity down here to help you ease into the new block, in addition to conditioning your pulling style
20 sets of 2 reps - pull these as fast as you possibly can
Same as on the deload I want you to record these from the side and monitor your starting position on the deadlift

workouts.title: Pendlay Row - SS - Week 10
notes: rpe 6 load - get really good movements here please

workouts.title: Pronated Pull Up - SS - Week 10
notes: 2s hang at the bottom of each rep here please !
last weeks 8RM set up from few weeks back
Make sure that you are still hanging for 2 seconds between each rep. If you need to strap up fucking go for it, if you need to do these assisted in anyway etc again this is fine.

workouts.title: Single Arm Cable Row - SS - Week 10
notes: Make sure to be getting a big stretch at the start of each rep, rotate and squeeze into your pocket for 2 seconds each rep

workouts.title: Incline DB Supinated Bicep Curl - SS - Week 10
EZ Bar Bicep Curl - SS - Week 10
High Hang Pull - SS - Week 10
notes: 3 sets of 10 reps - light load here about 62.5% of your best clean ever clean-
Really control that bar into the hip crease, make sure youre exploding from that triple extension position, make sure you keep that bar really close after extension.

workouts.title: Power Clean/Push Press - SS - Week 10
notes: Make these technically perfect now, we've had a solid 10 weeks of work on clean, should feel like you're ready for the olympics now!

workouts.title: BTN Seated Strict Press - SS - Week 10
notes: Behind The Neck Seated Strict Press
2 sets of 10 reps - 2s pause at the bottom and top of each rep

workouts.title: Short Step Lunge - SS - Week 10
notes: Ideally use an SSB bar, but if you do not have one a regular barbell will work fine also.

I want your strides here to mimic the stride length of a yoke/farmers. Small step and lunge into it. Rather than think of this as an exercise to pump up your legs, think of it as assiting your moving events (and squat).

workouts.title: Deadlift Stance Leg Press - SS - Week 10
notes: Make sure that you're watching the video here guys, I want 1/2 reps here same amount of flexion you get when youre doing a deadlift. Think of this as an accessory for your deadlift rather than a "leg day"

workouts.title: Farmers Walks - SS - Week 10
notes: Work up to a top set of 20m - No time limit here, just get over the line with something heavy and solidfy a new 20m PB. Should be diving for the line difficulty today.

workouts.title: Loading Medley  SS - Week 10
notes: Final week so finish on a high. Should be very familiar and crisp with these now. Beat last weeks time. First set get a plan and then second set go for it.

workouts.title: Sandbag To Shoulder - SS - Week 10
workouts.reps: Work up to a new PB - Not an all out max here today but get up to something around the RPE 9 area (1 rep in the tank).

workouts.title: Stones To Platform - SS - Week 10
workouts.reps: Work up to a new PB - To the upper abdomen platform height here. Same format as the sandbag to shoudler. Get something heavy loaded but don't let technique standard slip.

workouts.title: Rower - SS - Week 10
notes: 4 rounds - aiming to keep a faster 500m pace each round than your best 2k rower time.
